attributes.action: Change the Equality Act 2010 so disadvantage has to be proven
attributes.additional_details:
Assuming disadvantage because of lower rates of participation assumes that without disadvantage people would behave identically when they don't.

A large portion of the population might reasonably think that disparity is only caused by disadvantage. 

This makes what a person reasonably thinks not a sufficient standard with which to determine actual disadvantage, certainly not sufficient to justify positive discrimination in hiring and promotion which is negative discrimination against others.
attributes.background: To add a section to the act that requires disadvantage regarding protected characteristics to be proven and not merely assumed based on low workforce participation rates or the standard of what a person reasonably thinks.

rejection.details:
Determining whether discrimination has taken place under the Equality Act is a matter for the Courts, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could start a petition calling for a ban on positive discrimination, if that is something you'd like to see happen.
